snippet: With Pier 40’s roof falling in and the pilings underneath it deteriorating, the pier has turned into a drain on Hudson River Park’s finances.
abstract: Hudson River Park Trust officials are considering closing Pier 40, 15-acre structure that sits over the Hudson River at Houston Street; pier had at one time generated $5 million a year in parking fees, but the deteriorating structure is now a drain on the park's finances, with a fraction of necessary roof repairs alone projected to run over $6 million; park officials say the main problem is that legislation creating the park severely restricts commercial uses of its piers, limiting the opportunity to generate cash for repairs.
lead_paragraph: With Pier 40’s roof falling in and the pilings underneath it deteriorating, the pier has turned into a drain on Hudson River Park’s finances.

headline.seo: Repair Costs Could Bring Down Pier 40
